content.description: An easy, but lovely 4th class scramble. Extra points if you climb it during a flow event. (Which would likely mean you're climbing it in the rain or immediately following one.) After about 100' the chasm narrows and the angle lessens greatly. You can access Old School Slab (and, *perhaps*, the top of The Waning WallÂ by continuing southward) if you scramble westward (climber's R) at the confluence.
content.location: The obvious, dark, low-angle invagination. It appears dead-vertical when viewed en face from the parking area, but it's actually quite low-angle.

content.description: This small wall with a decidedly northerly persuasion is easily viewed from the parking area. The namesake feature is readily identified by looking for a wide, dark streak in the approximate center of the wall.
